xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received June 8, 2021; revised August 5, 2021; accepted August 15, 2021. Date of publication August 19, 2021; date of current version September 14, 2021. This work was supported in part by the Science and Technology on Underwater Information and Control Laboratory under Grant 6142218200410, in part by the National Natural Science Foundation of China under Grant U1806201, in part by China Shipbuilding Industry Corporation No. 715 Research Institute under Grant 6142109180305, and in part by the State Administration of Science, Technology, and Industry for National Defense under Grant JCKYS2019604SSJS006. The associate editor coordinating the review of this manuscript and approving it for publication was Dr. Koby Todros. (Corresponding author: Feng Zhou.) The authors are with the Acoustic Science and Technology Laboratory, College of Underwater Acoustic Engineering, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin 150001, China, and also with the Key Laboratory of Marine Information Acquisition and Security, Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin 150001, China (e-mail: louyi@hrbeu.edu.cn; qiaogang@hrbeu.edu.cn; 2633785245@qq.com; zhoufeng@hrbeu.edu.cn). head.citation-title: Computationally Efficient Two-Dimensional DOA Estimation Algorithm Based on Quaternion Theory
head.abstracts: © 1994-2012 IEEE.In this letter, we present a novel computationally efficient DOA estimation algorithm based on quaternion theory for two-dimensional (2-D) direction-of-arrival (DOA) estimation. An orthogonal propagator method based on the cross-correlation of the quaternion models (OPM-CQM) is developed to alleviate the computation burden. To eliminate the effect of additive noise, we construct two quaternion-based signal models judiciously. Then, we obtain the statistics of the observed signals by performing the cross-correlation between the quaternion models. Meanwhile, the additive noise is eliminated without introducing other denoising methods. Moreover, the compact modeling approach based on quaternions provides a significant advantage to OPM-CQM in terms of computational effort. Simulations demonstrate that the proposed algorithm offers performance superiority in angular resolution compared with the non-quaternion schemes.

affiliation.ce:source-text: Acoustic Science and Technology Laboratory, College of Underwater Acoustic Engineering, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, China

publisher.publishername: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

Simulations demonstrate that the proposed algorithm offers performance superiority in angular resolution compared with the non-quaternion schemes.
coredata.dc:title: Computationally Efficient Two-Dimensional DOA Estimation Algorithm Based on Quaternion Theory
